perturbation.changed_text:
ScanSource, Inc., a company incorporated in South Carolina, with its registered office at 6 Logue Court, Greenville, South Carolina 29615 ("ScanSource").

ScanSource Latin America, Inc. a ScanSource Affiliate incorporated in Florida, whose registered business address is 1935 NW 87 Avenue, Miami, Florida 33172 ("ScanSource Latin America")

ScanSource Brazil Distribuidora de Technologias, Ltda., a ScanSource Affiliate incorporated and organized under the laws of Brazil, with offices in the City of Säo José dos Pinhais, State of Paranå, at Avenida Rui Barbosa, 2529, Modulos 11 and 12, Bairro Jardim Ipé, CEP: 83055-320, enrolled with the Taxpayer Register (CNPJ/MF) under No. 05.607.657/0001-35 ("ScanSource Brazil")

SCANSOURCE DE MEXICO S. DE R.L. DE C.V., a ScanSource Affiliate incorporated in Mexico, whose registered business address is Calle 4 No. 298, Colonia Franccionamiento Industrial Alce Blanco, Naucalpan de Juarez, Estado de México 53370 ("ScanSource Mexico")

(Collectively "Primary Distributor")
perturbation.explanation: The term "Distributor" is changed to "Primary Distributor" in this section. This creates an ambiguity because other sections of the agreement refer to "Distributor" without specifying if it includes all ScanSource entities or just the primary one. This could lead to disputes about which entity bears the responsibilities outlined in the contract.

perturbation.original_text: To order the Xplore Products, Distributor shall place a purchase order via sending an email to xpldistributors@zebra.com. Each purchase order shall specify the bill-to address, ship-to address, quantity and description of each Xplore Product ordered, the unit price for each Xplore Product, the requested ship date, the preferred means of delivery, and tax-exempt certifications, if any. Orders received without this information or which contain any discrepancy may be returned to Distributor for completion or revision as applicable. Each purchase order placed by Distributor, as well as each invoice sent by Xplore, shall be governed by the terms of this Addendum and the Distribution Agreement and any additional or different terms within the purchase order or invoice shall have no effect. Each purchase order for the Xplore Products shall be subject to Xplore's acceptance and, upon acceptance, Xplore shall confirm the purchase order and the Estimated Shipping Date with Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: To order the Xplore Products, Distributor shall place a purchase order via sending an email to xpldistributors@zebra.com. Each purchase order shall specify the bill-to address, ship-to address, quantity and description of each Xplore Product ordered, the unit price for each Xplore Product, the requested ship date, the preferred means of delivery, and tax-exempt certifications, if any. Orders received without this information or which contain any discrepancy may be returned to the Buyer for completion or revision as applicable. Each purchase order placed by Distributor, as well as each invoice sent by Xplore, shall be governed by the terms of this Addendum and the Distribution Agreement and any additional or different terms within the purchase order or invoice shall have no effect. Each purchase order for the Xplore Products shall be subject to Xplore's acceptance and, upon acceptance, Xplore shall confirm the purchase order and the Estimated Shipping Date with Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the term 'Distributor' is interchanged with 'Buyer' in the context of order revisions. This introduces confusion. Is the 'Buyer' the same as the 'Distributor,' or is this referring to a different entity entirely, such as an end-customer or reseller? This ambiguity can complicate the order revision process.
perturbation.location: EXHIBIT B - ARTICLE I. PURCHASE ORDERS AND STOCK ON HAND - 1. Issuance and Acceptance of Purchase Order

perturbation.original_text: Distributor has the right to cancel, reschedule or modify all or any portion of a purchase order that has been accepted by Xplore at no cost to Distributor only if such cancellation or modification request is made within [*****] business days of PO acceptance or rescheduling request is made at least [*****] business days prior to the most current Estimated Shipping Date for that purchase order. Distributor has the right to change the destination of all or any portion of a purchase order that has been accepted by Xplore at no cost to Distributor only if such change in destination request is made at least [*****] business days prior to the most current Estimated Shipping Date for that purchase order. Except as set forth above, purchase orders are non-changeable and non- cancellable by Distributor, once accepted by Xplore.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor has the right to cancel, reschedule or modify all or any portion of a purchase order that has been accepted by Xplore at no cost to the Customer only if such cancellation or modification request is made within [*****] business days of PO acceptance or rescheduling request is made at least [*****] business days prior to the most current Estimated Shipping Date for that purchase order. Distributor has the right to change the destination of all or any portion of a purchase order that has been accepted by Xplore at no cost to Distributor only if such change in destination request is made at least [*****] business days prior to the most current Estimated Shipping Date for that purchase order. Except as set forth above, purchase orders are non-changeable and non- cancellable by Distributor, once accepted by Xplore.
perturbation.explanation: The term "Distributor" is replaced with "Customer" regarding cancellation or modification request timelines. This creates a contradiction. The distributor cancelling a product is mentioned in one sentance, while a third party customer cancelling a product is mentioned in the next sentance. It is unclear whether "Customer" refers to the Distributor or a third-party purchaser from the Distributor, thus conflicting with the purchase order obligations.
perturbation.location: EXHIBIT B - ARTICLE I. PURCHASE ORDERS AND STOCK ON HAND - 2. Purchase Order Rescheduling, Cancellation and Modification
